Off heat, mix in 4 well-whisked egg yolks, 170g sugar, 40g almond meal; sift in 80g self-raising flour, mix. Fold in Y, of egg whites (beaten stiff with pinch of salt); fold back into rest of beaten whites. Put in buttered + floured 20cm tin, tap out air, bake 30min.

Triamcinolone has no mineralcorticoid action, 1 mg = 5mg hydrocortisone in glucocorticoid action. See also gramicidin combination cream and ointment.

name: Filter: Removes particles up to approx 20,000 Dalton
dosage: Filtrate: 10-50ml/kg/hr (monitor serum creatinine). Keep blood flow at least five times filtration rate. Heparin: 10Ou/kg in 50ml saline at 1-10ml/hr prefilter, 10 u/kg in 50ml saline at 1-10ml/hr postfilter; keep ACT 1.5 x nor­ mal (Actalyke 140-160). Citrate (no heparin): prefilter ACD 1.8ml/hr per 1 ml/min of blood flow (so prefilter ionised Ca <0.3 mmoi/L); postfilter 10% CaCI2 1 ml/hr (adjust so patient ionised Ca >1 mmoi/L). Replacement fluid: dextrose 0.18%, Na 135mmoi/L, K 3.5, Ca 1.7, Mg 0.7, Bic 25, Phos 1.0, Cl110, acetate balance. Nutrition: x2 normal amino acids, trace elements, vit B&C. PLASMAFILTRATION (VENO·VENOUS) Cannula, blood flow and heparin: as for haemofiltration. Filter: Removes particles of MW up to 3,000,000 Dalton. Filtrate: 20-50ml/kg/hr (a 2-volume plasma exchange is 20ml/kg/hr for 4hr). Blood flow <:5x filtrate flow. Acid citrate dextrose solution, formula A (ACDA): 1 ml/hr prefilter for every 1 ml/min of blood flow. Replacement fluid: albumin 30g/L, dextrose 0.3%, Na 135 mmoi/L, K 3.5, Ca 2.0, Mg 0. 7, bic 25, phos 1.5, Cl 100, acetate to balance. Give 1 bag FFP (about 230mt) per 800ml replacement, cryoprecipitate 5ml/kg (1 bag/4kg) if fibrinogen <2g/L, and immunoglob 0.5g/kg prn. ECMO Indications (preductal gas): Newborn 01 >0.4 or VI >90. Flow: VA: <10kg 100-150ml/kg/min, >10kg: 2.4Lim2/min; higher flows needed in sepsis. W: about 70% of VA flows. Ventilation of neonates: typically 10 x 20/10 (PIP minimum needed to move chest) in air. Heparin: 10Ou/kg cannulatn; then 20u/kg/hr, adjust to ACT.

Page 110 'CYTOCHROME P450 INTERACTIONS For more information, See Medical Letter 2016;58:e46-e47 and http://medicine.iupui.edu/CLJNPHARMtddis/clinlcal-table. Increase the dose of a substrate drug if it is given with a drug that induces the metabolism of that group, and reduce it when given with an Inhibitor. For example, phenytoin is metabolised by CYP2C9 (group 2C9), and this enzyme group is inhibited by fluconazole -so the dose of phen'Y1oin should be reduced if fluconazole is given to a patient who is already on phenytoin.
